item.title: Interactive Timelines of Nutrition, Food and Health
item.description: Next, we decided to establish a basic timeline of major events in the nutrition sciences over time. We decided to break this down into three distinct timelines based on science, politics and the social. item.title: Project Description
item.description: The 1969 White House Conference on Food, Nutrition, and Health had a significant influence on the direction of food and nutrition policy in the United States. The conference produced recommendations leading to federal legislation and programs to alleviate hunger and malnutrition, improve consumers’ nutrition knowledge through education and labeling, and monitor the nutritional status of the population. Fifty years later, its legacy was revisited at a conference convened by Harvard University and Tufts University.

item.title: Text Network of 1969 White House Conference Report
item.description: In the second section of our paper, we examined what policy makers discussed in the 1969 White House Conference. To garner some high-level insights, we used tidytext – a package developed for natural language processing in the R open-source software language – to visualize a network of textual relations in the WHC Report. This process entails cleaning and preprocessing the textual data from the WHC Report (i.e. selective lemmatization and removal of common words), quantifying the number of unique words in the corpus, constructing bigrams based on how many times words co-occur adjacent to one another in the text, and then constructing a network of textual relations comprised of the nodes and word co-occurrences.
